greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime factors of n-th Fibonacci number, counted with multiplicity.
comment: Row lengths of table A060441. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 30 2014
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1408 (terms 0..1000 from T. D. Noe derived from Kelly's data)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Fibonacci Number
formula: For n > 0: a(n) = A001222(A000045(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 30 2014
example: a(12) = 6 because Fibonacci(12) = 144 = 2^4 * 3^2 has 6 prime factors.
maple: with(numtheory):with(combinat):a:=proc(n) if n=0 then 0 else bigomega(fibonacci(n)) fi end: seq(a(n), n=0..102); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 11 2008
program: a038575 n = if n == 0 then 0 else a001222 $ a000045 n
xref: Cf. A022307 (number of distinct prime factors), A086597 (number of primitive prime factors).
results.author: _Jeff Burch_
